summary: This is an FBI 302 interview summary of a woman, referred to as [REDACTED], conducted in Beverly Hills on February 28, 2020. She details her recruitment in 2004 to give massages to Jeffrey Epstein, subsequent travel with him, his requests for her to recruit other young women, and her observations of Epstein's operations and associates, including Ghislaine Maxwell and others.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the interview; the individual who recruited the witness for massages, traveled with her, requested she find other young women for him, and provided her with financial support and career assistance.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Epstein's former girlfriend, the 'original girl finder' who arranged social interactions and found women for him. Witness heard gossip that Maxwell was mean to girls and was involved in an incident where a woman was burned during a mold-making attempt.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Epstein instructed the witness to contact Indyke if approached by law enforcement and not to speak with them directly.

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.role: Modeling agency executive, associate of Epstein
persons.context: Epstein suggested the witness intern with Brunel, whom she found creepy, disrespectful, and misogynistic. She heard he mistreated women and allegedly drugged someone.

persons.name: Faith
persons.context: Owner of NEXT MODEL MANAGEMENT. Epstein knew her since 1985 and would talk down to her. Witness heard Epstein ask Faith to find a girl for him in fall 2006.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Epstein introduced the witness to his friend Leon Black. She reacted negatively to the suggestion of setting him up with someone.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.role: Witness, former massage provider for Epstein
persons.context: The primary interviewee. A woman recruited in 2004 at age 22 to give massages to Epstein. She traveled with him, was asked to recruit other young women, and received career and financial support from him before distancing herself.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: A woman the witness met at a party who introduced her to the concept of massaging Epstein for money and provided Epstein's contact.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: Described as Epstein's assistant or girlfriend who traveled with them. Witness was surprised when she casually removed her top at Epstein's poolside command.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.role: Another young woman associated with Epstein
persons.context: A young woman from [REDACTED] who was in love with Epstein and had her emotions hurt. Present on trips around 2005-2006.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.role: Another young woman associated with Epstein
persons.context: A 19-year-old ballerina the witness met in Florida. Epstein paid for her school and sent her to Spain. She gave regular massages on the island.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.role: Another young woman associated with Epstein
persons.context: A 23-year-old woman who did not get along with [REDACTED] at some point.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: A mentor who taught Epstein how to dress and acted as a personal and social mentor.

connections.description: [REDACTED] was recruited to give Epstein massages, which involved sexual touching. He provided her financial support and career assistance while pressuring her to recruit other young women for him.

Maxwell is described as Epstein's former girlfriend and the 'original girl finder' who arranged social meetings and found women/girls for him. Epstein stated she had an understanding that her role was to introduce him to women.
Epstein instructed associates like [REDACTED] to contact attorney Darren Indyke if approached by law enforcement and not to speak with them.
Epstein suggested [REDACTED] intern with Brunel, indicating a professional and personal connection. Brunel was perceived negatively by the witness.
Epstein had known Faith since 1985, talked down to her, and asked her to find girls for him. She was the owner of a modeling agency where he placed [REDACTED].
Epstein introduced [REDACTED] to Leon Black and suggested she set up one of his friends with him, indicating a social relationship.
[REDACTED] introduced [REDACTED] to the concept of massaging Epstein for money and provided her with the initial contact.
[REDACTED] is described as Epstein's assistant or girlfriend who traveled with him, took notes, and ran errands. Their relationship also had inappropriate elements, as he asked her to remove her top.

events.title: [REDACTED] moves to Manhattan
events.description: The witness moved to Manhattan at age 22, shortly after which she was recruited to meet Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: First contact and massages with Epstein
events.description: [REDACTED] was introduced to Epstein and began giving him massages, which involved sexual touching. She visited his residence 4-5 times before being invited to travel.

events.title: Travel to Florida and Epstein's island
events.description: [REDACTED] traveled with Epstein, his assistant/girlfriend, and other girls to Florida and then to his private island. Epstein made promises of financial support in exchange for massages during travel.

events.title: Epstein's arrest (2006)
events.description: [REDACTED] learned Epstein had been arrested. He told her it was an enemy out to get him and instructed her to contact Darren Indyke if approached by law enforcement.

events.title: Incident involving Ghislaine Maxwell and breast mold
events.description: [REDACTED] heard from others that Ghislaine Maxwell wanted to make a mold of a woman's ([REDACTED]) breasts. The solution was mixed incorrectly, resulting in a 2nd degree burn.

events.title: [REDACTED] works at Bear Stearns
events.description: Epstein helped [REDACTED] get a job at Bear Stearns from March 2007 to May 2008. Their contact decreased during this period.

events.title: Epstein asks [REDACTED] to recruit again after jail
events.description: After his release from jail, Epstein shocked [REDACTED] by asking her, 'When are you going to start producing?'â€”pressuring her to find girls for massages again.

events.title: FBI interview of [REDACTED]
events.description: The witness was interviewed by the FBI and other officials in Beverly Hills, California, providing detailed information about her experiences with Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The witness ([REDACTED]) was recruited in 2004 at age 22 to give massages to Jeffrey Epstein, which involved sexual activity, in exchange for implied financial support.

Epstein had a systematic operation: he requested the witness and other women to recruit 'clean cut, slim, attractive' girls aged 18-23, and maintained a schedule of three massage appointments per day.
Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly identified as the 'original girl finder' for Epstein, with a understood role of introducing him to women and arranging social interactions.
Following his 2006 arrest, Epstein instructed the witness to contact his attorney, Darren Indyke, if approached by law enforcement, and to not speak with them.
The witness describes a pattern of emotional manipulation, where Epstein would mentor and support young women while simultaneously exploiting them and hurting their emotions.
